page.title: 09Farming at Chatsworth
page.content: The area of land is classified as permanent pasture or long term leys. Reseeding only occurring in enclosed fields to "bulk up" grass for conservation purposes. All the level enclosed fields are mowable for either silage or hay, silage being preferred as it is a much better winter feed. Livestock kept are mainly cattle and sheep, although small herds of deer graze the parkland. The sheep flock is primarily a Mule flock (Swaledale x Blue Faced Leicester) which are crossed with Suffolk, Hampshire Down and Texel rams to produce ideal finished lambs for sale. A small purebred Jacob flock is also kept but managed as a commercial flock. The beef herd of Hereford x Friesian cows are autumn calving to Limousin and Charolais bulls with progeny sold at fifteen months as store cattle.
